fields.description:
we create a memory table by arrow and the source data come from HBase.
Create a memory table and then drop the table,there will be a memory leak.
Hundreds of times,There will be OutOfMemoryError.
anyone encounter similar problems?

comments.body: Hello, [~fushengxu]. Can you provide a code sample how you interact with Arrow and HBase? From your message it is unclear how to reproduce the problem.
[~fushengxu] this isn't enough information to advise on the memory leak. Most likely you have code that has failed to call {{release()}} on ArrowBuf objects.
Is it possible to post the implementation of the Arrow*Pillar classes?
In fact, it has nothing to do with HBase.Other data sources can also cause memory leaks
Hello,[~xhochy] and [~wesmckinn],do I need to provide more detailed information?
[~julienledem] [~jnadeau] do you have any advice for helping track down a memory leak which may be Arrow-related?

[~fushengxu] To verify that your code calls close() or release() in the right places, You can write a unit  test that creates a RootAllocator first (typically in before()) and closes the allocator at the end (in after()). Closing an allocator that still has allocated resources will throw an exception.
FYI: I have added \{code\} blocks in your comments to make them more readable.
Is this still a problem with arrow-0.3.0?
Won't the buffer allocator hold on to and re-use buffers? You might have to close the allocator to free those resources.
[~wesmckinn] the arrow has not been upgraded to version 1.3，we are now using arrow-0.1.0
Not dealing with Multithreading well，  lead to memory can not be released.It's our own problem,not arrow's problem.
Transitioning issue from Resolved to Closed to based on resolution field value.
